Kebahagiaan akan dapat dicapai bilamana umat itu terus-menerus mengembangkan daya berpikir mereka dengan pengamatan dan penelitian kehidupan spiritual dan material.
70.text_translation: lalu mereka tergesa-gesa mengikuti jejak (nenek moyang) mereka.
70.text_translation_en: and [now] they make haste to follow in their footsteps!

71.text_tafsir_en: In this verse Allah explains that most of the people long ago before the Prophet Muhammad (saw) had gone astray. They worship idols and associate them with God and often do damage to the earth by waging war. Their lives are based on lust and crime. Their leaders and state leaders were persecuted and oppressed the people by forcing them to build palaces and temples where they worshiped idols and royal tombs. There are even those who claim to be God and the people are forced to worship them. Such are the stories of ancient peoples such as the 'Ad, Samud, Namrud kings, Pharaohs, and others.
71.text_tafsir: Pada ayat ini Allah menerangkan bahwa sebagian besar umat-umat zaman dahulu sebelum Nabi Muhammad saw telah sesat. Mereka menyembah berhala dan mempersekutukannya dengan Tuhan dan seringkali berbuat kerusakan di atas bumi dengan mengadakan peperangan. Hidup mereka didasarkan atas hawa nafsu dan angkara murka. Pemimpin-pemimpin mereka dan pembesar-pembesar negara berlaku aniaya dan menindas rakyat dengan kerja paksa membangun istana-istana dan kuil-kuil tempat penyembahan berhala dan makam-makam raja. Bahkan ada di antara mereka yang mengaku Tuhan dan rakyat dipaksa menyembah mereka. Demikianlah kisah-kisah umat-umat zaman dahulu seperti kaum 'Ad, Samud, raja Namrud, Fir'aun, dan lain-lainnya.
71.text_translation: Dan sungguh, sebelum mereka (Suku Quraisy), telah sesat sebagian besar dari orang-orang yang dahulu,
71.text_translation_en: Thus, indeed, most of the people of old went astray before them,

72.text_tafsir_en: Then Allah sent the ancient prophets and apostles to uphold the religion of piety, performing amar ma'ruf nahi munkar. Prophets were warners who fought to straighten the path of human life that deviated from its nature. They showed his people the right and the wrong, the good and the bad, and reminded them of the torment that would come upon them if they would not abandon their error and would not submit to the truth brought by the apostles. But the prophets and apostles were opposed, denied, and persecuted, even some of whom were persecuted to death. The presence of the apostles in their midst was seen as a hindrance to the stability of their lives, and therefore they remained in error and darkness. In the end came the punishment of the Lord upon them as God explained in his word: As for the Samaritans, they were destroyed with a mighty voice, while the people of Ad, they were destroyed by a very cold tempest. (al-haqqah / 69: 5-6)
72.text_tafsir:
Lalu Allah mengutus kepada umat-umat dahulu itu nabi-nabi dan rasul-rasul untuk menegakkan agama tauhid, menjalankan amar ma'ruf nahi munkar. Nabi-nabi itu merupakan pemberi peringatan yang berjuang untuk meluruskan jalan hidup manusia yang menyimpang dari fitrah kejadiannya. Mereka menunjukkan kepada kaumnya jalan yang hak dan yang batil, jalan yang baik dan yang buruk, serta mengingatkan kepada mereka azab yang akan menimpa bila mereka tidak mau meninggalkan kesesatan dan tidak mau tunduk kepada kebenaran yang dibawa rasul-rasul.

Tetapi nabi-nabi dan rasul-rasul itu ditentang, didustakan dan dimusuhi, bahkan ada di antara mereka yang dianiaya sampai dibunuh. Kehadiran para rasul di tengah-tengah mereka itu dipandang sebagai gangguan bagi kemantapan kehidupan mereka, karena itu mereka tetap dalam kesesatan dan kegelapan. Kesudahannya datanglah azab Tuhan menimpa mereka sebagaimana diterangkan Allah dalam firman-Nya:

Maka adapun kaum Samud, mereka telah dibinasakan dengan suara yang sangat keras, sedangkan kaum 'Ad, mereka telah dibinasakan dengan angin topan yang sangat dingin. (al-haqqah/69: 5-6)
72.text_translation: dan sungguh, Kami telah mengutus (rasul) pemberi peringatan di kalangan mereka.
72.text_translation_en: although, verily, We had sent warners unto them:

73.text_tafsir_en: (73-74) In this verse Allah calls upon the Messenger of Allah and his people to pay attention to the fate of the people who rejected them. Their former ruins can still be seen in the form of ancient relics. By observing the history of the people of old, they will receive lessons to reflect on the warnings given by the Prophet Muhammad. Not all the people in the nation disobeyed the Messenger of God who came to them and suffered torture in return for their disobedience. But among them were the servants of God who believed in him with a sincere heart and obeyed his commands and prohibitions. They are saved from torment and are endowed with worldly happiness and the afterlife.
73.text_tafsir:
(73-74) Pada ayat ini Allah menyerukan kepada Rasulullah saw dan umatnya untuk memperhatikan nasib kaum-kaum yang mendustakan rasul-rasul itu. Bekas-bekas kehancuran mereka itu masih dapat disaksikan berupa peninggalan purbakala. Dengan memperhatikan sejarah umat dahulu, mereka akan memperoleh pelajaran untuk merenungkan peringatan-peringatan yang disampaikan oleh Nabi Muhammad saw.

Tidaklah semua orang yang berada dalam kaum itu mengingkari utusan Tuhan yang datang kepada mereka dan mengalami siksaan sebagai balasan terhadap keingkaran kaum itu. Tetapi di antara mereka terdapat hamba-hamba Allah yang beriman kepada-Nya dengan setulus hati beramal saleh, menaati segala perintah dan larangan-Nya. Mereka diselamatkan dari siksaan dan dianugerahi kebahagiaan dunia dan akhirat.
73.text_translation: Maka perhatikanlah bagaimana kesudahan orang-orang yang diberi peringatan itu,
73.text_translation_en: and behold what happened in the end to those that had been warned [to no avail]!

74.text_tafsir_en: In this verse Allah calls upon the Messenger of Allah and his people to pay attention to the fate of the people who rejected them. Their former ruins can still be seen in the form of ancient relics. By observing the history of the people of old, they will receive lessons to reflect on the warnings given by the Prophet Muhammad. Not all the people in the nation disobeyed the Messenger of God who came to them and suffered torture in return for their disobedience. But among them were the servants of God who believed in him with a sincere heart and obeyed his commands and prohibitions. They are saved from torment and are endowed with worldly happiness and the afterlife.
74.text_tafsir:
Pada ayat ini Allah menyerukan kepada Rasulullah saw dan umatnya untuk memperhatikan nasib kaum-kaum yang mendustakan rasul-rasul itu. Bekas-bekas kehancuran mereka itu masih dapat disaksikan berupa peninggalan purbakala. Dengan memperhatikan sejarah umat dahulu, mereka akan memperoleh pelajaran untuk merenungkan peringatan-peringatan yang disampaikan oleh Nabi Muhammad saw.

Tidaklah semua orang yang berada dalam kaum itu mengingkari utusan Tuhan yang datang kepada mereka dan mengalami siksaan sebagai balasan terhadap keingkaran kaum itu. Tetapi di antara mereka terdapat hamba-hamba Allah yang beriman kepada-Nya dengan setulus hati beramal saleh, menaati segala perintah dan larangan-Nya. Mereka diselamatkan dari siksaan dan dianugerahi kebahagiaan dunia dan akhirat.
74.text_translation: kecuali hamba-hamba Allah yang disucikan (dari dosa).
74.text_translation_en: EXCEPT for God’s true servants, [most people are apt to go astray.]

75.text_tafsir_en: This verse explains that Noah prayed to God for help against the threat of persecution from his people. They even intended to kill him when he called them to monotheism. Although it was quite a long time for Noah to call upon his people day and night, in secret and openly, but few among them believed. Each time they were warned and taught, they grew far from religion and intensified their hostility toward Noah. This caused Noah to be very disappointed and he prayed to God that the unbelievers would be destroyed immediately. The Word of God: And Noah said, "O my Lord, do not let any of the heathen dwell on the earth. They were wicked and ungrateful people. (Noah / 71: 26-27) God answered the prayer of Noah, and he called himself the best substance of the prayer. reject and oppose it.
75.text_tafsir:
Ayat ini menerangkan bahwa Nabi Nuh berdoa kepada Tuhan supaya memberikan pertolongan kepadanya terhadap ancaman penganiayaan dari kaumnya. Bahkan mereka sudah bermaksud membunuhnya sewaktu dia menyeru mereka kepada agama tauhid.

Meskipun cukup lama Nabi Nuh menyeru kaumnya siang dan malam, secara sembunyi dan terang-terangan, namun hanya sedikit di antara mereka yang beriman. Setiap kali diberi peringatan dan pengajaran, mereka bertambah jauh dari agama dan tambah sengit permusuhannya kepada Nabi Nuh. Hal itu menyebabkan Nabi Nuh sangat kecewa lalu dia berdoa kepada Tuhan agar orang-orang kafir itu segera dibinasakan. Firman Allah:

Dan Nuh berkata, "Ya Tuhanku, janganlah Engkau biarkan seorang pun di antara orang-orang kafir itu tinggal di atas bumi. Sesungguhnya jika Engkau biarkan mereka tinggal, niscaya mereka akan menyesatkan hamba-hamba-Mu, dan mereka hanya akan melahirkan anak-anak yang jahat dan tidak tahu bersyukur. (Nuh/71: 26-27)

Allah mengabulkan doa Nabi Nuh itu. Allah menyebutkan dirinya sebagai Zat yang paling baik dalam mengabulkan doa. Pengabulan itu sangat diharapkan oleh Nabi Nuh pada saat itu karena kaumnya mendustakan dan menentangnya.
75.text_translation: Dan sungguh, Nuh telah berdoa kepada Kami, maka sungguh, Kamilah sebaik-baik yang memperkenankan doa.
75.text_translation_en: And, indeed, [it was for this reason that] Noah cried unto Us - and how excellent was Our response:

76.text_tafsir_en: Then explained the kind of prayer Noah was given, among other things: First, God saved Noah and his believers, including some of his sons, from the great catastrophe of the great hurricane of a great flood. One of his sons drowned. Those who survived the great flood were those on board. The Word of God: Then We saved Noah and those who were with him in the ark. Then afterwards We drowned the remaining inhabitants. (asy-Syu'ara '/ 26: 119-120) Second, God made the descendants of Noah a descendant of Noah, and those who rebelled against his cry were destroyed, just as Noah had requested in his prayer. Third, God bestowed the praises and honorable names of Noah among the prophets who came later and mankind to the end of time. He was well-known among the Muslims, including one of the five apostles called ulul 'azmi which means people of good fortune. The other four apostles were Abraham, Moses, Jesus, and Muhammad.
76.text_tafsir:
Kemudian dijelaskan jenis doa Nabi Nuh yang dikabulkan itu, antara lain: Pertama, Allah telah menyelamatkan Nuh beserta orang-orang yang beriman, termasuk beberapa orang putranya, dari bencana yang besar yakni angin topan yang dahsyat dibarengi banjir besar. Seorang putranya ikut tenggelam. Mereka yang selamat dari banjir besar itu ialah mereka yang berada dalam kapal. Firman Allah:

Kemudian Kami menyelamatkannya Nuh dan orang-orang yang bersamanya di dalam kapal yang penuh muatan. Kemudian setelah itu Kami tenggelamkan orang-orang yang tinggal. (asy-Syu'ara'/26: 119-120)

Kedua, Allah menjadikan anak cucu Nabi Nuh orang yang akan melanjutkan keturunannya, dan mereka yang membangkang dan menentang seruannya dibinasakan, seperti yang dimohon Nabi Nuh dalam doanya. 

Ketiga, Allah mengabadikan pujian dan nama yang harum bagi Nuh di kalangan para nabi yang datang kemudian dan umat manusia sampai akhir zaman. Beliau masyhur di kalangan kaum muslimin, termasuk salah seorang dari lima rasul yang disebut ulul 'azmi yang artinya orang-orang yang mempunyai keteguhan hati. Empat rasul lainnya ialah Ibrahim, Musa, Isa, dan Muhammad saw.
76.text_translation: Kami telah menyelamatkan dia dan pengikutnya dari bencana yang besar.
76.text_translation_en: for We saved him and his household from that awesome calamity,

77.text_tafsir_en: Then explained the kind of prayer Noah was given, among other things: First, God saved Noah and his believers, including some of his sons, from the great catastrophe of the great hurricane of a great flood. One of his sons drowned. Those who survived the great flood were those on board. The Word of God: Then We saved Noah and those who were with him in the ark. Then afterwards We drowned the remaining inhabitants. Beliau masyhur di kalangan kaum muslimin, termasuk salah seorang dari lima rasul yang disebut ulul 'azmi yang artinya orang-orang yang mempunyai keteguhan hati. Empat rasul lainnya ialah Ibrahim, Musa, Isa, dan Muhammad saw.
77.text_translation: Dan Kami jadikan anak cucunya orang-orang yang melanjutkan keturunan.
77.text_translation_en: and caused his offspring to endure [on earth];

78.text_tafsir_en: Then explained the kind of prayer Noah was given, among other things: First, God saved Noah and his believers, including some of his sons, from the great catastrophe of the great hurricane of a great flood. One of his sons drowned. Those who survived the great flood were those on board. The Word of God: Then We saved Noah and those who were with him in the ark. Then afterwards We drowned the remaining inhabitants. (asy-Syu'ara '/ 26: 119-120) Second, God made the descendants of Noah a descendant of Noah, and those who rebelled against his cry were destroyed, just as Noah had requested in his prayer. Third, God bestowed the praises and honorable names of Noah among the prophets who came later and mankind to the end of time. He was well-known among the Muslims, including one of the five apostles called ulul 'azmi which means people of good fortune. The other four apostles were Abraham, Moses, Jesus, and Muhammad.
78.text_tafsir:
Kemudian dijelaskan jenis doa Nabi Nuh yang dikabulkan itu, antara lain: Pertama, Allah telah menyelamatkan Nuh beserta orang-orang yang beriman, termasuk beberapa orang putranya, dari bencana yang besar yakni angin topan yang dahsyat dibarengi banjir besar. Seorang putranya ikut tenggelam. Mereka yang selamat dari banjir besar itu ialah mereka yang berada dalam kapal. Firman Allah:

Kemudian Kami menyelamatkannya Nuh dan orang-orang yang bersamanya di dalam kapal yang penuh muatan. Kemudian setelah itu Kami tenggelamkan orang-orang yang tinggal. (asy-Syu'ara'/26: 119-120)

Kedua, Allah menjadikan anak cucu Nabi Nuh orang yang akan melanjutkan keturunannya, dan mereka yang membangkang dan menentang seruannya dibinasakan, seperti yang dimohon Nabi Nuh dalam doanya. 

Ketiga, Allah mengabadikan pujian dan nama yang harum bagi Nuh di kalangan para nabi yang datang kemudian dan umat manusia sampai akhir zaman. Beliau masyhur di kalangan kaum muslimin, termasuk salah seorang dari lima rasul yang disebut ulul 'azmi yang artinya orang-orang yang mempunyai keteguhan hati. Empat rasul lainnya ialah Ibrahim, Musa, Isa, dan Muhammad saw.
78.text_translation: Dan Kami abadikan untuk Nuh (pujian) di kalangan orang-orang yang datang kemudian;
78.text_translation_en: and We left him thus to be remembered among later generations:

79.text_tafsir_en: Then it was pronounced a goodbye for Noah "Salamun 'ala Nuhin" as a lesson for angels, jinn, and humans so that they would also say goodbye to Noah until the Day of Resurrection. Allah says: It is said, "O Noah! Peace be upon you, and on your behalf, and for all the people who are with you." then the name of Noah will be remembered and remembered all the time.
79.text_tafsir:
Kemudian disebutkan salam kesejahteraan bagi Nuh "Salamun 'ala Nuhin" sebagai pengajaran bagi para malaikat, jin, dan manusia supaya mereka juga mengucapkan salam sejahtera kepada Nuh sampai hari Kiamat. Allah berfirman:

Difirmankan, "Wahai Nuh! Turunlah dengan selamat sejahtera dan penuh keberkahan dari Kami, bagimu dan bagi semua umat (mukmin) yang bersamamu. (Hud/11: 48)

Dengan ucapan salam sejahtera untuk Nuh oleh umat manusia dari masa ke masa maka nama Nabi Nuh akan tetap harum dan diingat sepanjang masa.
79.text_translation: ”Kesejahteraan (Kami limpahkan) atas Nuh di seluruh alam.”
79.text_translation_en: “Peace be upon Noah throughout all the worlds!”

80.text_tafsir_en: The naming of Noah by the mention of his greetings was a tribute to him, and his retribution for his virtues and his struggle in upholding his endless monotheistic sentences, day and night, openly and secretly for hundreds of years. It is also in return for his patience, in holding back the pain of birth and inwardness while delivering a leaflet among his people. What inspired Noah to work hard to lead his people was the purity and sincerity of his devotion to God with the strength of faith in his soul. Therefore, God declares that he is truly His faithful servant. The prominence of faith in Noah's personal praise as an apostle is to show great significance to that faith as he is the capital of all charities. As for the rest of the people of Noah, who refused to believe in the monotheistic religion that was being passed down to them, they were destroyed by a typhoon and a great flood until none of them survived and no trace of their remains was remembered. They disappeared from the records of human history.
80.text_tafsir:
Pengabadian nama Nuh dengan sebutan salam sejahtera kepadanya itu merupakan penghormatan kepadanya, dan pembalasan kepadanya atas kebajikan yang diperbuatnya dan perjuangannya dalam menegakkan kalimat tauhid yang tak henti-hentinya, siang dan malam, terang-terangan dan sembunyi-sembunyi selama ratusan tahun. Hal itu juga sebagai imbalan atas kesabarannya, dalam menahan derita lahir dan batin selama menyampaikan risalah di tengah-tengah kaumnya.

Yang mendorong Nabi Nuh bekerja keras membimbing kaumnya adalah kemurnian dan keikhlasan pengabdiannya kepada Allah disertai keteguhan iman dalam jiwanya. Oleh karena itu, Allah menyatakan bahwa dia benar-benar hamba-Nya yang penuh iman. Penonjolan iman pada pribadi Nuh sebagai rasul yang mendapat pujian adalah untuk menunjukkan arti yang besar terhadap iman itu karena dia merupakan modal dari segala amal perbuatan kebajikan.

Adapun kaum Nuh yang lain, yang tidak mau beriman kepada agama tauhid yang disampaikan kepada mereka, dibinasakan oleh topan dan banjir besar hingga tak seorang pun di antara mereka yang tinggal dan tak ada pula bekas peninggalan mereka yang dikenang. Mereka lenyap dari catatan sejarah manusia.
80.text_translation: Sungguh, demikianlah Kami memberi balasan kepada orang-orang yang berbuat baik.
80.text_translation_en: Verily, thus do We reward the doers of good –

81.text_translation: Sungguh, dia termasuk di antara hamba-hamba Kami yang beriman.
81.text_translation_en: for he was truly one of our believing servants:

82.text_translation_en: [and so We saved him and those who followed him] and then We caused the others to drown.

83.text_tafsir_en: This verse explains that Abraham was a descendant and successor of the Book of Noah. He followed the footsteps of Noah in carrying out the teachings of monotheism, believing in the Day of Judgment, fighting for the spread of monotheism and belief in the Day of Judgment, executing almighty nahi munkar and perseverance and persevering in the face of hostility.
83.text_tafsir: Ayat ini menerangkan bahwa Nabi Ibrahim termasuk keturunan dan penerus risalah Nabi Nuh. Beliau mengikuti jejak Nabi Nuh dalam memegang ajaran tauhid, meyakini akan adanya hari Kiamat, memperjuangkan penyebaran agama tauhid dan kepercayaan akan hari Kiamat, melaksanakan amar ma'ruf nahi munkar serta tabah dan sabar dalam menghadapi permusuhan kaum kafir.
83.text_translation_en: AND, BEHOLD, of his persuasion was Abraham, too,

84.text_tafsir_en: This verse emphasizes the purity of the soul of Abraham. He presents his soul to the Supreme Lord with all sincerity, purity of greed, detachment from the interests of earthly life, and far from any other evil that may disturb his soul.
84.text_tafsir: Ayat ini mempertegas lagi kemurnian jiwa Nabi Ibrahim. Dia menghadapkan jiwanya kepada Tuhan Yang Maha Esa dengan penuh keikhlasan, bersih dari kemusyrikan, terlepas dari kepentingan kehidupan duniawi, dan jauh dari perasaan buruk lainnya yang dapat mengganggu jiwanya.
84.text_translation: (Ingatlah) ketika dia datang kepada Tuhannya dengan hati yang suci,
84.text_translation_en: when he turned to his Sustainer with a heart free of evil,

85.text_tafsir_en: Then God reminds us of the story of Abraham when he with his pure and sincere soul told his parents and his people why they worshiped the statues. It should not have happened if they were thinking of idolatrous idols that did not benefit or harm them: The Word of God: (Remember) when he (Abraham) said to his father, "O my father! who did not hear, did not see, and could not help you yet? O my father! Indeed, some knowledge which was not given to you has come to me, so follow me, and I will show you a straight path. "(Mary / 19: 42-43 ) Abraham explicitly stated to them that it was not right for those who wanted other than Allah to worship for unjust reasons. To worship the supernatural God needed guidance instead of worship was based on their own delusions and appetites. This will bring many forms of worship to God according to the conception of each person God. In ignorance, every Arab family had their own idols and statues according to their own minds. Similarly in the days of Abraham there were many sculptures of their worship as a result of the imagination of his people at that time. Abraham, whom God had given knowledge that was not given to his people, certainly sought to change that. Then he asked various questions to his people and forced them to think about each other on the basis of their assumption that they did not worship the Creator and Ruler of the universe, instead they associated him with statues and idols. In fact, they cannot come up with a reason to reject the worship of the One True God.
85.text_tafsir:
Kemudian Allah mengingatkan kita tentang kisah Nabi Ibrahim ketika dia dengan jiwanya yang bersih dan tulus ikhlas berkata kepada orang tuanya dan kaumnya mengapa mereka menyembah patung-patung. Seharusnya hal itu tidak patut terjadi jika mereka mau berpikir tentang patung-patung sembahan yang tidak memberi manfaat dan tidak pula memberi mudarat kepada mereka:

Firman Allah:

(Ingatlah) ketika dia (Ibrahim) berkata kepada ayahnya, "Wahai ayahku! Mengapa engkau menyembah sesuatu yang tidak mendengar, tidak melihat, dan tidak dapat menolongmu sedikit pun? Wahai ayahku! Sungguh, telah sampai kepadaku sebagian ilmu yang tidak diberikan kepadamu, maka ikutilah aku, niscaya aku akan menunjukkan kepadamu jalan yang lurus. (Maryam/19: 42-43)

Nabi Ibrahim dengan tegas menyatakan kepada mereka bahwa tidaklah benar sikap mereka yang menghendaki selain Allah untuk disembah dengan alasan-alasan yang tidak benar. Untuk menyembah Tuhan yang gaib diperlukan petunjuk kalau tidak penyembahan itu tentulah didasarkan atas khayalan-khayalan dan selera pikiran masing-masing orang. Hal demikian ini akan menimbulkan banyaknya bentuk penyembahan kepada Tuhan sesuai dengan konsepsi masing-masing orang tentang Tuhan.

Pada zaman Jahiliah, tiap-tiap kabilah Arab mempunyai berhala dan patung sendiri-sendiri sesuai dengan pikirannya masing-masing. Demikian juga zaman Nabi Ibrahim terdapat banyak patung sembahan mereka sebagai hasil imajinasi kaumnya pada waktu itu. Nabi Ibrahim yang diberi Allah ilmu pengetahuan yang tidak diberikan kepada kaumnya, tentulah beliau berusaha untuk mengubah keadaan demikian. Lalu beliau mengemukakan berbagai pertanyaan kepada kaumnya sehingga terpaksa mereka berpikir tentang diri mereka masing-masing apa dasar anggapan mereka tidak menyembah Tuhan Pencipta dan Penguasa semesta alam, bahkan sebaliknya mereka mempersekutukan-Nya dengan patung-patung dan berhala-berhala. Sebenarnya mereka tidak dapat mengemukakan alasan untuk menolak menyembah Tuhan Yang Maha Esa.
85.text_translation: (ingatlah) ketika dia berkata kepada ayahnya dan kaumnya, “Apakah yang kamu sembah itu?
85.text: اِذْ قَالَ لِاَبِيْهِ وَقَوْمِهٖ مَاذَا تَعْبُدُوْنَ ۚ
85.text_translation_en: and [thus] spoke to his father and his people: “What is it that you worship?

86.text_translation: Apakah kamu menghendaki kebohongan dengan sesembahan selain Allah itu?
86.text_translation_en: Do you want [to bow down before] a lie - [before] deities other than God?

87.text_translation: Maka bagaimana anggapanmu terhadap Tuhan seluruh alam?”
87.text_translation_en: What, then, do you think of the Sustainer of all the worlds?”

88.text_tafsir_en: Abraham then gazed at the stars in contemplation of how to face his people who still insisted on worshiping the statue, only for the sake of preserving their ancestral heritage. In fact, he gave them a warning and a warning, as Allah said: (Remember) when he (Abraham) said to his father and his people, "What are these statues that you worship?" They answered, "We found our ancestors worshiping him." (al-Anbiya '/ 21: 52-53) After much thought and consideration, he decides to take the dangerous action, which is to destroy all the idolatrous idols. At one point, the Abrahamites came to invite him to their big day. He refuses to accept their request softly because his health is disturbed. In addition to avoiding the presence of their big day, Abraham intends to carry out his plan to destroy the statues, and to proclaim openly against the worshipers of the statues. His people did not know the plan of Abraham and did not suspect it. It also does not appear in his attitude that he is dishonest in his words. Thus, their great day's ceremony took place without the presence of Abraham. The reason for his health being disturbed for not attending to the invitation of his people, when in fact he was not ill, was not viewed as a prohibited religion. That Abraham lied to his people was true. The Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: Abraham did not lie except for three words, two of which were about the substance of God, his words "I am sick" and "this great one solved it", and his words about his wife Sarah "this is my brother". (History of Abu and Asya-Abu Shaykh from Abu Hurairah) The words of Prophet Ibrahim that his health was disturbed in public were to avoid his presence at the ceremony of his people. Ibrahim said, "Indeed, my father and I are in grave error". They said, "Are you really coming to us or are you one of those guys playing around?" Abraham said, "Indeed your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth which He has created, and I am among those who can bear witness to it. For Allah's sake, I will surely deceive your idols after you leave." In celebration of the great day, Abraham used the opportunity to destroy the statues of his people. Ibrahim's words that the greatest statue that broke it were uttered while he was being examined by his people on the matter of demolishing the statue. In fact, he broke the statue himself, but it is said that it was the biggest one that destroyed it, when his people realized that the statues could do nothing. Abraham's second speech was spoken in the context of his struggle to uphold the monotheistic sentence. As for the third word, "Sarah is my brother" when in fact his wife was spoken before the king when the king desired Sarah. Thus, the three words that Abraham spoke were not lies that were defamatory in religious and social viewpoints. The Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) explained that the three words of Abraham were permissible in religion, as the Prophet saw: The Messenger of Allah spoke of the three words of Abraham saying that there is no lie except the things that are permitted by the religion of Allah. (At-Tirmidzi History of Abu Sa'id)
88.text_tafsir:

88.text_translation: Lalu dia memandang sekilas ke bintang-bintang,
88.text_translation_en: Then he cast a glance at the stars,

89.text_tafsir_en: Abraham then gazed at the stars in contemplation of how to face his people who still insisted on worshiping the statue, only for the sake of preserving their ancestral heritage. In fact, he gave them a warning and a warning, as Allah said: (Remember) when he (Abraham) said to his father and his people, "What are these statues that you worship?" They answered, "We found our ancestors worshiping him." (al-Anbiya '/ 21: 52-53) After much thought and consideration, he decides to take the dangerous action, which is to destroy all the idolatrous idols. At one point, the Abrahamites came to invite him to their big day. He refuses to accept their request softly because his health is disturbed. In addition to avoiding the presence of their big day, Abraham intends to carry out his plan to destroy the statues, and to proclaim openly against the worshipers of the statues. His people did not know the plan of Abraham and did not suspect it. It also does not appear in his attitude that he is dishonest in his words. Thus, their great day's ceremony took place without the presence of Abraham. The reason for his health being disturbed for not attending to the invitation of his people, when in fact he was not ill, was not viewed as a prohibited religion. That Abraham lied to his people was true. The Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: Abraham did not lie except for three words, two of which were about the substance of God, his words "I am sick" and "this great one solved it", and his words about his wife Sarah "this is my brother". (History of Abu and Asya-Abu Shaykh from Abu Hurairah) The words of Prophet Ibrahim that his health was disturbed in public were to avoid his presence at the ceremony of his people. Ibrahim said, "Indeed, my father and I are in grave error". They said, "Are you really coming to us or are you one of those guys playing around?" Abraham said, "Indeed your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth which He has created, and I am among those who can bear witness to it. For Allah's sake, I will surely deceive your idols after you leave." In celebration of the great day, Abraham used the opportunity to destroy the statues of his people. Ibrahim's words that the greatest statue that broke it were uttered while he was being examined by his people on the matter of demolishing the statue. In fact, he broke the statue himself, but it is said that it was the biggest one that destroyed it, when his people realized that the statues could do nothing. Abraham's second speech was spoken in the context of his struggle to uphold the monotheistic sentence. As for the third word, "Sarah is my brother" when in fact his wife was spoken before the king when the king desired Sarah. Thus, the three words that Abraham spoke were not lies that were defamatory in religious and social viewpoints. The Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) explained that the three words of Abraham were permissible in religion, as the Prophet saw: The Messenger of Allah spoke of the three words of Abraham saying that there is no lie except the things that are permitted by the religion of Allah. (At-Tirmidzi History of Abu Sa'id)

90.text_translation: Lalu mereka berpaling dari dia dan pergi meninggalkannya.
90.text_translation_en: and at that they turned their backs on him and went away.

91.text_tafsir_en: After his people left, Abraham secretly went to the place of the statues, saying with a scorn, "Why are they not eating the food that was served before him?" The offerings were offered by his worshipers on certain days in hopes of blessing. Of course the statues don't say anything. However, Abraham asked again, "Why don't the statues answer my question?" Then he beat the statues to ruin except one of the largest. This event angered his people. They searched for the culprit and found out that it was Abraham who broke the statues. They hurried to Abraham and asked him if he really broke the statues. Abraham avoided the question and said that it was the large statue that broke it. After hearing Abraham's words, the people bowed their heads and contemplated each other. There was nothing they could do about the great statue they worshiped.
91.text_tafsir:
Sesudah kaumnya pergi, Ibrahim diam-diam menuju tempat patung-patung itu, lalu berkata dengan maksud mengejek, "Mengapa patung-patung itu tidak memakan makanan yang dihidangkan di hadapannya." Sesajen itu disuguhkan oleh para penyembahnya pada hari-hari tertentu untuk mengharapkan berkah.

Tentu saja patung-patung itu tidak berkata apa-apa. Akan tetapi, Ibrahim bertanya lagi, "Mengapa patung-patung itu tidak menjawab pertanyaanku?" Kemudian patung-patung itu dipukulnya dengan keras sampai hancur kecuali sebuah patung yang paling besar. Peristiwa ini menimbulkan kemarahan kaumnya. Lalu mereka mencari pelakunya dan memperoleh keterangan bahwa Ibrahimlah yang memecahkan patung-patung itu. Mereka cepat-cepat menemui Ibrahim dan menanyakan kepadanya, apakah benar dia memecahkan patung-patung itu. Ibrahim mengelak dari pertanyaan itu dan mengatakan bahwa patung yang besar itulah yang memecahkannya. Setelah mendengar ucapan Ibrahim, kaumnya menundukkan kepala dan merenungkan diri masing-masing. Tidak ada yang dapat mereka perbuat terhadap patung besar itu, yang selama ini mereka sembah.
91.text_translation: Kemudian dia (Ibrahim) pergi dengan diam-diam kepada berhala-berhala mereka; lalu dia berkata, “Mengapa kamu tidak makan?
91.text: فَرَاغَ اِلٰٓى اٰلِهَتِهِمْ فَقَالَ اَلَا تَأْكُلُوْنَۚ
91.text_translation_en: Thereupon he approached their gods stealthily and said, “What! You do not eat [of the offerings placed before you]?

After hearing Abraham's words, the people bowed their heads and contemplated each other. There was nothing they could do about the great statue they worshiped.
94.text_tafsir:
Sesudah kaumnya pergi, Ibrahim diam-diam menuju tempat patung-patung itu, lalu berkata dengan maksud mengejek, "Mengapa patung-patung itu tidak memakan makanan yang dihidangkan di hadapannya." Sesajen itu disuguhkan oleh para penyembahnya pada hari-hari tertentu untuk mengharapkan berkah.

Tentu saja patung-patung itu tidak berkata apa-apa. Akan tetapi, Ibrahim bertanya lagi, "Mengapa patung-patung itu tidak menjawab pertanyaanku?" Kemudian patung-patung itu dipukulnya dengan keras sampai hancur kecuali sebuah patung yang paling besar. Peristiwa ini menimbulkan kemarahan kaumnya. Lalu mereka mencari pelakunya dan memperoleh keterangan bahwa Ibrahimlah yang memecahkan patung-patung itu. Mereka cepat-cepat menemui Ibrahim dan menanyakan kepadanya, apakah benar dia memecahkan patung-patung itu. Ibrahim mengelak dari pertanyaan itu dan mengatakan bahwa patung yang besar itulah yang memecahkannya. Setelah mendengar ucapan Ibrahim, kaumnya menundukkan kepala dan merenungkan diri masing-masing. Tidak ada yang dapat mereka perbuat terhadap patung besar itu, yang selama ini mereka sembah.
94.text_translation_en: [But] then the others came towards him hur­riedly [and accused him of his deed].

95.text_tafsir_en: After seeing his people stunned to bow his head, Abraham repeated to them that they should not worship the statues they had chiseled with his own hands. They should be thankful that among themselves, born a sensible person, prevents the worship of the statues. Abraham emphasized that the only worshipers who worshiped them and their idols were worshipers. God the Creator is more worthy of worship than His creatures. Allah's Word: He said: "Why do you worship other than Allah, which is of no benefit, and does not harm you? Woe to you and what you worship besides Allah! Do you not understand?" (al-Anbiya '/ 21: 66-67) The reason given by Abraham was that they could not argue for a reason, so they resorted to violence against Abraham. They planned to kill Abraham. Then a building was built to be the place where Abraham would be burned. When the building was finished and the fire was lit, Abraham was thrown into it. The Word of God: They say, "Burn him down and help your gods if you really want to." (al-Anbiya '/ 21: 68) The people of Abraham really wanted it to be consumed and burned in the fire. However, God intended to save him from destruction by ordering fire not to burn Abraham, as He said: We (Allah) say, "O fire! Be cool, and save Abraham!" (al-Anbiya '/ 21: 69) Thus, Abraham was saved from the fire, and gained victory over the disbelievers. After he saw no sign of his people being ready to believe, he decided to leave, emigrating from his hometown. Perhaps in this new place, he could worship God without interruption from the disobedient people, and he could develop a religion with the devotion and guidance of God. The country he was going to was Jerusalem.
95.text_tafsir:
Sesudah melihat keadaan kaumnya tertegun menunduk-kan kepala, Nabi Ibrahim lalu berkata lagi kepada mereka bahwa tidak patut mereka menyembah patung-patung yang mereka pahat dengan tangannya sendiri. Mereka mestinya bersyukur bahwa dari kalangan mereka sendiri, lahir seorang yang punya akal pikiran, yang mencegah penyembahan patung-patung itu. Nabi Ibrahim menegaskan lagi bahwa yang patut disembah hanyalah Allah yang menciptakan mereka dan patung-patung sesembahan mereka itu. Tuhan Maha Pencipta lebih berhak disembah daripada makhluk-Nya. Firman Allah:

Dia (Ibrahim) berkata, "Mengapa kamu menyembah selain Allah, sesuatu yang tidak dapat memberi manfaat sedikit pun, dan tidak (pula) mendatangkan mudarat kepada kamu? Celakalah kamu dan apa yang kamu sembah selain Allah! Tidakkah kamu mengerti?" (al-Anbiya'/21: 66-67)

Alasan yang disampaikan Nabi Ibrahim tidak dapat mereka bantah dengan alasan pula, sehingga mereka menempuh cara kekerasan menantang Ibrahim. Mereka merencanakan membunuh Ibrahim. Lalu didirikanlah sebuah bangunan untuk dijadikan tempat pembakaran Nabi Ibrahim. Ketika bangunan itu telah selesai dan apinya telah dinyalakan, lalu Nabi Ibrahim dilemparkan ke dalamnya. Firman Allah:

Mereka berkata, "Bakarlah dia dan bantulah tuhan-tuhan kamu, jika kamu benar-benar hendak berbuat." (al-Anbiya'/21: 68)

Kaum Ibrahim benar-benar menghendaki ia binasa dan hangus terbakar dalam unggun api itu. Akan tetapi, Allah berkehendak menyelamatkan dia dari kebinasaan dengan memerintahkan kepada api supaya tidak membakar Ibrahim, sebagaimana firman-Nya:

Kami (Allah) berfirman, "Wahai api! Jadilah kamu dingin, dan penyelamat bagi Ibrahim!" (al-Anbiya'/21: 69)

Dengan demikian, Nabi Ibrahim selamat dari unggun api, dan mendapat kemenangan atas orang kafir.

Sesudah beliau tidak melihat lagi tanda-tanda kesediaan kaumnya untuk beriman, maka beliau bermaksud untuk meninggalkan mereka, hijrah dari kampung halaman. Barangkali di tempat yang baru itu, beliau dapat beribadah kepada Tuhan tanpa gangguan dari kaum yang ingkar, dan dapat mengembangkan agama dengan taufik dan hidayah Allah. Adapun negeri yang beliau tuju ialah Baitulmakdis.

99.text_translation: Dan dia (Ibrahim) berkata, “Sesungguhnya aku harus pergi (menghadap) kepada Tuhanku, Dia akan memberi petunjuk kepadaku.
99.text: وَقَالَ اِنِّيْ ذَاهِبٌ اِلٰى رَبِّيْ سَيَهْدِيْنِ
99.text_translation_en: And [Abraham] said: “Verily, I shall [leave this land and] go wherever my Sustainer will guide me!”

100.text_tafsir_en: This verse tells us that Abraham, on the other hand, begged God to grant him a virtuous and obedient child and could assist him in delivering his preaching and accompanying him on the journey and being a friend in solitude. The presence of the child in lieu of the family and people he left behind. Abraham's request was approved by Allah. To him was conveyed the glad tidings that God would grant him a man of great temperament. The patient's temperament appears at the end of the day. Because in childhood there are very few traits such as patience, stamina, and chest size. The child was Ishmael, the first son of Abraham, whose mother was Hajar the second wife of Abraham. Isaac's second son was born after Ishmael of Abraham's first wife, Sarah.
100.text_tafsir:
Ayat ini mengisahkan bahwa Nabi Ibrahim dalam perantauan memohon kepada Tuhan agar dianugerahi seorang anak yang saleh dan taat serta dapat menolongnya dalam menyampaikan dakwah dan mendampinginya dalam perjalanan dan menjadi kawan dalam kesepian.

Kehadiran anak itu sebagai pengganti dari keluarga dan kaumnya yang ditinggalkannya. Permohonan Nabi Ibrahim ini diperkenankan oleh Allah. Kepadanya disampaikan berita gembira bahwa Allah akan menganugerahkan kepadanya seorang anak laki-laki yang punya sifat sangat sabar.

Sifat sabar itu muncul pada waktu balig. Karena pada masa kanak-kanak sedikit sekali didapati sifat-sifat seperti sabar, tabah, dan lapang dada. Anak remaja itu ialah Ismail, anak laki-laki pertama dari Ibrahim, ibunya bernama Hajar istri kedua dari Ibrahim. Putra kedua ialah Ishak, lahir kemudian sesudah Ismail dari istri pertama Ibrahim yaitu Sarah.
100.text_translation: Ya Tuhanku, anugerahkanlah kepadaku (seorang anak) yang termasuk orang yang saleh.”
100.text_translation_en: [And he prayed:] “O my Sustainer! Bestow upon me the gift of [a son who shall be] one of the righteous!” –

101.text_tafsir_en: This verse tells us that Abraham, on the other hand, begged God to grant him a virtuous and obedient child and could assist him in delivering his preaching and accompanying him on the journey and being a friend in solitude. The presence of the child in lieu of the family and people he left behind. Abraham's request was approved by Allah. To him was conveyed the glad tidings that God would grant him a man of great temperament. The patient's temperament appears at the end of the day. Because in childhood there are very few traits such as patience, stamina, and chest size. The child was Ishmael, the first son of Abraham, whose mother was Hajar the second wife of Abraham. Isaac's second son was born after Ishmael of Abraham's first wife, Sarah.
101.text_tafsir:
Ayat ini mengisahkan bahwa Nabi Ibrahim dalam perantauan memohon kepada Tuhan agar dianugerahi seorang anak yang saleh dan taat serta dapat menolongnya dalam menyampaikan dakwah dan mendampinginya dalam perjalanan dan menjadi kawan dalam kesepian.

Kehadiran anak itu sebagai pengganti dari keluarga dan kaumnya yang ditinggalkannya. Permohonan Nabi Ibrahim ini diperkenankan oleh Allah. Kepadanya disampaikan berita gembira bahwa Allah akan menganugerahkan kepadanya seorang anak laki-laki yang punya sifat sangat sabar.

Sifat sabar itu muncul pada waktu balig. Karena pada masa kanak-kanak sedikit sekali didapati sifat-sifat seperti sabar, tabah, dan lapang dada. Anak remaja itu ialah Ismail, anak laki-laki pertama dari Ibrahim, ibunya bernama Hajar istri kedua dari Ibrahim. Putra kedua ialah Ishak, lahir kemudian sesudah Ismail dari istri pertama Ibrahim yaitu Sarah.
101.text_translation: Maka Kami beri kabar gembira kepadanya dengan (kelahiran) seorang anak yang sangat sabar (Ismail).
101.text_translation_en: whereupon We gave him the glad tiding of a boy-child gentle [like himself]?

102.text_tafsir_en: Then this verse describes Abraham's difficult test. God commanded him to sacrifice his only child as a sacrifice in God's sight. At that time, Ismail was approaching adolescence or adolescence, an age when children could help their parents' work. According to al-Farra ', Ismail was 13 years old. Abraham with a sad heart told Ishmael about the commands God had given him in a dream. She asked for her son's opinion on the order. It is a commandment of God regarding the slaughter of his own children, which is a great trial for parents and children. After obeying the Lord's command, Ishmael, with all his humility, asked his father to do whatever he was told to do. He will obey, willingly, and sincerely accept God's will and uphold all of His commandments and submit to Him. The young Ishmael told his parents that he would not fear the ordeal, would not hesitate to accept the qada and qadar of God. He persevered and patiently endured the pain of the slaughter. Ismail's attitude is highly praised by God in his words: And tell (Muhammad), the story of Ismail in the Book (the Qur'an). He was a very promising man, an apostle and a prophet. (Mary / 19: 54)
102.text_tafsir:
Kemudian ayat ini menerangkan ujian yang berat bagi Ibrahim. Allah memerintahkan kepadanya agar menyembelih anak satu-satunya sebagai korban di sisi Allah. Ketika itu, Ismail mendekati masa balig atau remaja, suatu tingkatan umur sewaktu anak dapat membantu pekerjaan orang tuanya. Menurut al-Farra', usia Ismail pada saat itu 13 tahun. Ibrahim dengan hati yang sedih memberitahukan kepada Ismail tentang perintah Tuhan yang disampaikan kepadanya melalui mimpi. Dia meminta pendapat anaknya mengenai perintah itu. Perintah Tuhan itu berkenaan dengan penyembelihan diri anaknya sendiri, yang merupakan cobaan yang besar bagi orang tua dan anak. 

Sesudah mendengarkan perintah Tuhan itu, Ismail dengan segala kerendahan hati berkata kepada ayahnya agar melaksanakan segala apa yang diperintahkan kepadanya. Dia akan taat, rela, dan ikhlas menerima ketentuan Tuhan serta menjunjung tinggi segala perintah-Nya dan pasrah kepada-Nya. Ismail yang masih sangat muda itu mengatakan kepada orang tuanya bahwa dia tidak akan gentar menghadapi cobaan itu, tidak akan ragu menerima qada dan qadar Tuhan. Dia dengan tabah dan sabar akan menahan derita penyembelihan itu. Sikap Ismail sangat dipuji oleh Allah dalam firman-Nya:

Dan ceritakanlah (Muhammad), kisah Ismail di dalam Kitab (Al-Qur'an). Dia benar-benar seorang yang benar janjinya, seorang rasul dan nabi. (Maryam/19: 54)
102.text_translation: Maka ketika anak itu sampai (pada umur) sanggup berusaha bersamanya, (Ibrahim) berkata, “Wahai anakku! Sesungguhnya aku bermimpi bahwa aku menyembelihmu. Maka pikirkanlah bagaimana pendapatmu!” Dia (Ismail) menjawab, “Wahai ayahku! Lakukanlah apa yang diperintahkan (Allah) kepadamu; insya Allah engkau akan mendapatiku termasuk orang yang sabar.”
102.text: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ السَّعْيَ قَالَ يٰبُنَيَّ اِنِّيْٓ اَرٰى فِى الْمَنَامِ اَنِّيْٓ اَذْبَحُكَ فَانْظُرْ مَاذَا تَرٰىۗ قَالَ يٰٓاَبَتِ افْعَلْ مَا تُؤْمَرُۖ سَتَجِدُنِيْٓ اِنْ شَاۤءَ اللّٰهُ مِنَ الصّٰبِرِيْنَ
102.text_translation_en: And [one day,] when [the child] had become old enough to share in his [father’s] endeavours, the latter said: “O my dear son! I have seen in a dream that I should sacrifice thee: consider, then, what would be thy view!” [Ishmael] answered: “O my father! Do as thou art bidden: thou wilt find me, if God so wills, among those who are patient in adversity!”

103.text_tafsir_en: When they had surrendered to God and submitted to His will, Ishmael knelt down and covered his face to the ground so that Abraham could not see his son's face again. Ismail intentionally did that so that his father would not see his face. Thus Abraham could quickly complete his work. Abraham began to draw his knife to kill him. At that moment, the voice of an angel from behind, sent to Abraham, said that the purpose of God's dream through the dream had been fulfilled with Ishmael being slaughtered. Abraham's action was a sincere obedience to God's command and provision. After the angel delivered the revelation, they both rejoiced and gave thanks to God who endowed them with joy and strength to face the ordeal. To both of them Allah has the reward and the reward for having shown sincere devotion. They can overcome the feeling of fatherhood alone in order to uphold the commandments of God. According to A.hmad's account of Ibn 'Abbas, when Ibrahim was commanded to perform the worship of the devil, a demon came. Satan tried to fight him, but Ibrahim succeeded in leading him to the Aqabah Jumrah. Satan tempted him again, but Abraham threw him at the stone seven times until he fled. At noon the devil came again and tempted him, but Abraham threw him seven times. Then Abraham told his son to put his face down for slaughter. Ismail was wearing a white long sleeve shirt. He said to his father, "O my father, there is no cloth to cover me except my dress shirt, so release it so that you can give it to me." Then Abraham started to take off the dress, but at that moment there was a voice behind him saying, "Ibrahim, you have faithfully carried out your dream." Abraham turned around, and suddenly a white sheep was in front of him.
103.text_tafsir:
Tatkala keduanya sudah pasrah kepada Tuhan dan tunduk atas segala kehendak-Nya, kemudian Ismail berlutut dan menelungkupkan mukanya ke tanah sehingga Ibrahim tidak melihat lagi wajah anaknya itu. Ismail sengaja melakukan hal itu agar ayahnya tidak melihat wajahnya. Dengan demikian Nabi Ibrahim bisa dengan cepat menyelesaikan pekerjaannya. Nabi Ibrahim mulai menghunus pisaunya untuk menyembelihnya. Pada waktu itu, datanglah suara malaikat dari belakangnya, yang diutus kepada Ibrahim, mengatakan bahwa tujuan perintah Allah melalui mimpi itu sudah terlaksana dengan ditelungkupkannya Ismail untuk disembelih. Tindakan Ibrahim itu merupakan ketaatan yang tulus ikhlas kepada perintah dan ketentuan Allah. Sesudah malaikat menyampaikan wahyu itu, maka keduanya bergembira dan mengucapkan syukur kepada Allah yang menganugerahkan kenikmatan dan kekuatan jiwa untuk menghadapi ujian yang berat itu. Kepada keduanya Allah memberikan pahala dan ganjaran yang setimpal karena telah menunjukkan ketaatan yang tulus ikhlas. Mereka dapat mengatasi perasaan kebapakan semata-mata untuk menjunjung perintah Allah.

Menurut riwayat A.hmad dari Ibnu 'Abbas, tatkala Ibrahim diperintahkan untuk melakukan ibadah sa'i, datanglah setan menggoda. Setan mencoba berlomba dengannya, tetapi Ibrahim berhasil mendahuluinya sampai ke Jumrah Aqabah. Setan menggodanya lagi, tetapi Ibrahim melemparinya dengan batu tujuh kali hingga dia lari. Pada waktu jumratul wustha datang lagi setan menggodanya, tetapi dilempari oleh Ibrahim tujuh kali. Kemudian Ibrahim menyuruh anaknya menelungkupkan mukanya untuk segera disembelih. Ismail waktu itu sedang mengenakan baju gamis (panjang) putih. Dia berkata kepada bapaknya, "Wahai bapakku, tidak ada kain untuk mengafaniku kecuali baju gamisku ini, maka lepaskanlah supaya kamu dengan gamisku dapat mengafaniku." Maka Ibrahim mulai menanggalkan baju gamis itu, tapi pada saat itulah ada suara di belakang menyerunya, "Hai Ibrahim, kamu sudah melaksanakan dengan jujur mimpimu." Ibrahim segera berpaling, tiba-tiba seekor domba putih ada di hadapannya.
103.text_translation: Maka ketika keduanya telah berserah diri dan dia (Ibrahim) membaringkan anaknya atas pelipis(nya), (untuk melaksanakan perintah Allah).
103.text_translation_en: But as soon as the two had surrendered themselves to [what they thought to be] the will of God, and [Abraham] had laid him down on his face,

104.text_translation_en: We called out to him: “O Abraham,

105.text_translation: sungguh, engkau telah membenarkan mimpi itu.” Sungguh, demikianlah Kami memberi balasan kepada orang-orang yang berbuat baik.
105.text: قَدْ صَدَّقْتَ الرُّؤْيَا ۚاِنَّا كَذٰلِكَ نَجْزِى الْمُحْسِنِيْنَ
105.text_translation_en: thou hast already fulfilled [the purpose of] that dream- vision!” Thus, verily, do We reward the doers of good:

106.text_tafsir_en: In this verse it is emphasized that what Abraham and his son experienced was a very difficult test. It is the right of God to test the servant whom He wills with His chosen form of burden and burden. Once the test has been set, no one can reject it and avoid it. Behind those difficult trials, there is a wisdom and secret that is beyond the reach of the human mind. Ishmael, who was once sacrificed to test Abraham's obedience, was replaced by a clean, unblemished white lamb. This event of the slaughter of goats by the Prophet Abraham, which was the basis of the worship offering to draw near to God, was continued by the Prophet Muhammad. This offering of worship was performed on pilgrimage / feast day or on tasyriq days, three consecutive days after the feast day, the 11th, 12, 13 Zulhijah. The sacrificial animals consist of livestock such as camels, cows, buffaloes, and goats. It is said that the sacrificial animal is not defective, not sick, and of sufficient age. Sacrificing animals for this sacrifice is the law of the sunnah muakkadah (emphasized sunah). The word of Allah: So do the prayer for your Lord, and sacrifice (as a worship and draw near to Allah). (al-Kautsar / 108: 2) With the fulfillment of sacrificial worship in Islam, the events of Abraham's slaughter of his son will be remembered forever and followed by his people. Sacrifice worship also promotes Islam because the sacrificial meat is distributed to the public, especially to the poor.
106.text_tafsir:
Pada ayat ini ditegaskan bahwa apa yang dialami Ibrahim dan putranya itu merupakan batu ujian yang amat berat. Memang hak Allah untuk menguji hamba yang dikehendaki-Nya dengan bentuk ujian yang dipilih-Nya berupa beban dan kewajiban yang berat. Bila ujian itu telah ditetapkan, tidak seorang pun yang dapat menolak dan menghindarinya. Di balik cobaan-cobaan yang berat itu, tentu terdapat hikmah dan rahasia yang tidak terjangkau oleh pikiran manusia.

Ismail yang semula dijadikan kurban untuk menguji ketaatan Ibrahim, diganti Allah dengan seekor domba besar yang putih bersih dan tidak ada cacatnya. Peristiwa penyembelihan kambing oleh Nabi Ibrahim ini yang menjadi dasar ibadah kurban untuk mendekatkan diri kepada Allah, dilanjutkan oleh syariat Nabi Muhammad. Ibadah kurban ini dilaksanakan pada hari raya haji/raya kurban atau pada hari-hari tasyriq, yakni tiga hari berturut-turut sesudah hari raya kurban, tanggal 11, 12, 13 Zulhijah.

Hewan kurban terdiri dari binatang-binatang ternak seperti unta, sapi, kerbau, dan kambing. Diisyaratkan binatang kurban itu tidak cacat badannya, tidak sakit, dan cukup umur. Menyembelih binatang untuk kurban ini hukumnya sunnah muakkadah(sunah yang ditekankan).

Firman Allah:

Maka laksanakanlah salat karena Tuhanmu, dan berkurbanlah (sebagai ibadah dan mendekatkan diri kepada Allah). (al-Kautsar/108: 2)

Dengan disyariatkannya ibadah kurban dalam agama Islam, maka peristiwa Ibrahim menyembelih anaknya akan tetap dikenang selama-lamanya dan diikuti oleh umatnya. Ibadah kurban juga menyemarakkan agama Islam karena daging-daging kurban itu dibagi-bagikan kepada masyarakat terutama kepada fakir miskin.
106.text_translation: Sesungguhnya ini benar-benar suatu ujian yang nyata.
106.text_translation_en: for, behold, all this was indeed a trial, clear in itself.

Dengan disyariatkannya ibadah kurban dalam agama Islam, maka peristiwa Ibrahim menyembelih anaknya akan tetap dikenang selama-lamanya dan diikuti oleh umatnya. Ibadah kurban juga menyemarakkan agama Islam karena daging-daging kurban itu dibagi-bagikan kepada masyarakat terutama kepada fakir miskin.
107.text_translation: Dan Kami tebus anak itu dengan seekor sembelihan yang besar.
107.text_translation_en: And We ransomed him with a tremendous sacrifice,

108.text_tafsir_en: These verses explain that people of all religions (samawi) and those who love Abraham all the time. Jews, Christians, and Muslims respected and praised his name, and even Arab scholars admit that their religion also embraces Islam (Ibrahim). Thus God fulfilled the prayer of Abraham when he prayed: And make me a good word for those who will come, and make me a heir to a paradise full of pleasure. (asy-Syu'ara '/ 26: 84-85) Then Allah rewarded Abraham that He had greeted him with peace. Peace to Abraham continued to live among men and even among angels. Thus, three rewards were bestowed upon him by God, a big goat being brought to him in exchange for his son, a sacrifice that gave him the honor of his name at all times, and the blessed greetings of God and man. That's how God rewards His servants for doing good. All these rewards in return for obedience to God's commands. Abraham achieved this feat because of the strong faith and sincerity of his worship of God that included his faithful servants.
108.text_tafsir:
Ayat-ayat ini menerangkan bahwa umat manusia dari berbagai agama (samawi) dan golongan mencintai Nabi Ibrahim sepanjang masa. Penganut agama Yahudi, Nasrani, dan Islam menghormatinya dan memuji namanya, bahkan kaum musyrik Arab mengakui bahwa agama mereka juga mengikuti agama Islam (Ibrahim).

Demikianlah Allah memenuhi permohonan Nabi Ibrahim ketika berdoa: 

Dan jadikanlah aku buah tutur yang baik bagi orang-orang (yang datang) kemudian, dan jadikanlah aku termasuk orang yang mewarisi surga yang penuh kenikmatan. (asy-Syu'ara'/26: 84-85)

Kemudian Allah memberikan penghargaan kepada Ibrahim bahwa Dia memberikan salam sejahtera kepadanya. Salam sejahtera untuk Ibrahim ini terus hidup di tengah-tengah umat manusia bahkan juga di kalangan malaikat. Dengan demikian, ada tiga pahala yang telah dianugerahkan Allah kepadanya, yaitu seekor kambing besar yang didatangkan kepadanya sebagai ganti dari anaknya, pengabadian yang memberi keharuman namanya sepanjang masa, dan ucapan salam sejahtera dari Tuhan dan manusia. Begitulah Allah memberikan ganjaran kepada hamba-hamba-Nya yang berbuat kebaikan. Semua ganjaran itu sebagai imbalan ketaatannya melaksanakan perintah Allah.

Ibrahim mencapai prestasi yang tinggi itu karena dorongan iman yang kuat dan keikhlasan ibadahnya kepada Allah sehingga dia termasuk hamba-hamba-Nya yang beriman.
108.text_translation: Dan Kami abadikan untuk Ibrahim (pujian) di kalangan orang-orang yang  datang kemudian,

111.text_translation: Sungguh, dia termasuk hamba-hamba Kami yang beriman.
111.text_translation_en: for he was truly one of our believing servants.

112.text_tafsir_en: This verse explains that God had told Abraham the happy news of the birth of a son by his first wife, Sarah. This story was conveyed by an angel, who pretended to be a human, when he came to her house when Sarah was old. Allah's Word: Then he (Abraham) feared them. They said, "Do not be afraid," and they announced to him the birth of a pious son (Isaac). Then his wife came into a giggle and patted his own face and said, "(I am) a barren old woman." They said, "Thus says your Lord. He is the Mighty, the All-Knowing." (adz-dzariyat / 51: 28-30) The angel also announced that Isaac was a prophet and that Jacob would be descended from Jacob, a prophet. They include the servants of the godly God, the benevolent, and the good of his people. Regarding this news of Isaac's birth, Allah also mentions in other passages such as Surah Hud / 11: 69-73, Surah Maryam / 19: 49 and Surah al-Anbiya '/ 21: 72. Among scholars scholars are of the opinion that Isaac that Abraham would sacrifice to fulfill God's command, not his brother Ishmael. Ibn Katsir in his interpretation quotes al-Bagawi's statement that Umar, Ali, Ibn Mas'ud and al-'Abbas (Ibn 'Abbas) thought that Isaac would be the victim. The source of this opinion is from Jews who converted to Islam. According to Ibn Katsir, all opinions that say that Isaac will be slaughtered are from the Press. He was a Jew who converted to Islam during the Caliphate of Umar, and read the contents of the Torah to Umar. Speaking on the issue of disagreement about this slaughter, Ibn al-Qayyim in his book Zadul Ma'ad said that the correct opinion of the scholars of the Companions, the Tabinites, and the later scholars, Ismaillah, was the sacrifice of Ibrahim. Opinions that say that Isaac was wrongly viewed in many ways. Ibn Taimiyah, as quoted by Ibn al-Qayyim, says, "This opinion was borne out by the scholars of the Book, though it contradicts the contents of the book itself." In the Torah it is said that God commanded Abraham to sacrifice his first born son. Both the Muslims and the Bible agree that the first born son was Ismail. But later, they made the interpretation of the Torah with the words: Sacrifice your son Isaac. According to Ibn Taimiyah, "That was the addition of the Jewish dissertation, as it was contrary to the words of the first son, their only enmity to the descendants of Ishmael who obtained glory, causing them to falsify the contents of this book." The second reason given by Ibn Taimiyah is based on the Qur'anic explanation: So We gave him glad tidings of the (birth) of Isaac and the coming of Isaac (the birth) of Jacob. (Hud / 11: 71) God informed Sarah of the birth of Isaac, who would give birth to a son named Jacob. It would be impossible for God to convey Isaac's birth and order his slaughter when it was revealed that Jacob would be born. How could Jacob have been born into the world if his father had been sacrificed, when he was promised to be born of Isaac? So it was not Isaac who was sacrificed but Ishmael. The third reason Ibn Taimiyah refers to the news of Abraham and his son in this Surah ash-shaffat. In verses 103-111 it is told that Abraham would sacrifice his son to carry out the command of God, and there came a voice of rebuke from behind, calling for Abraham to act in accordance with God's command. In his sincere obedience, Abraham received a reward and praise from God. After this event, God informed Abraham of Isaac's birth, as a reward for his patience and obedience. Thus, of course, not Isaac would be slaughtered, since he was not yet born. The fourth reason: that the events of Abraham's slaughter of his son occurred near Mecca, no one doubts. Therefore, the sacrificial worship was held on pilgrimage. Also the relationship between Safa and Marwah and throwing a jumrah in the pilgrimage is a memory of events that happened to Ishmael and his mother. As is well known, Ishmael and his mother lived in Mecca. The time and place of worship is always associated with Jerusalem. If Isaac was to be sacrificed, surely the sacrificial worship would be held at the place where Isaac lived (Sham), not in Mecca. These are some of the reasons that Ibn Taimiyah put forward to argue that Isaac was the one to be slaughtered. (See also the descriptions in the vocabulary of Abraham and Ismail)
112.text_tafsir:
Ayat ini menjelaskan bahwa Allah telah menyampaikan berita gembira kepada Ibrahim tentang akan lahirnya seorang putra dari istrinya yang pertama, Sarah. Berita ini disampaikan oleh malaikat, yang menyamar sebagai manusia, ketika bertamu ke rumahnya padahal ketika itu Sarah sudah tua. Firman Allah: 

Maka dia (Ibrahim) merasa takut terhadap mereka. Mereka berkata, "Janganlah kamu takut," dan mereka memberi kabar gembira kepadanya dengan (kelahiran) seorang anak yang alim (Ishak). Kemudian istrinya datang memekik (tercengang) lalu menepuk wajahnya sendiri seraya berkata, "(Aku ini) seorang perempuan tua yang mandul." Mereka berkata, "Demikianlah Tuhanmu berfirman. Sungguh, Dialah Yang Mahabijaksana, Maha Mengetahui." (adz-dzariyat/51: 28-30)

Malaikat juga memberitahukan bahwa Ishak itu adalah seorang nabi dan darinya akan diturunkan Yakub yang juga seorang nabi. Keduanya adalah termasuk hamba-hamba Allah yang saleh, orang yang suka berbuat kebajikan, dan membawa kemaslahatan kepada umatnya.

Mengenai berita kelahiran Ishak ini, diberitakan Allah juga dalam surah-surah lain seperti dalam Surah Hud/11: 69-73, Surah Maryam/19: 49 dan Surah al-Anbiya'/21: 72.

Di kalangan ulama tafsir terdapat pendapat bahwa Ishaklah yang akan disembelih oleh Ibrahim untuk memenuhi perintah Tuhan, bukan kakaknya Ismail. Ibnu Katsir dalam tafsirnya mengutip keterangan al-Bagawi menyatakan bahwa Umar, Ali, Ibnu Mas'ud dan al-'Abbas (Ibnu 'Abbas) berpendapat Ishaklah yang akan dijadikan korban itu. Sumber pendapat demikian ini adalah dari orang Yahudi yang masuk agama Islam. Menurut Ibnu Katsir, semua pendapat yang mengatakan bahwa Ishak yang akan disembelih bersumber dari Ka'bul-Akhbar. Dia seorang Yahudi yang masuk Islam pada zaman Khalifah Umar, dan membacakan isi kitab Taurat itu kepada Umar. 

Berbicara masalah perbedaan pendapat tentang sembelihan ini, Ibnu al-Qayyim dalam kitabnya Zadul Ma'ad mengatakan bahwa pendapat yang benar menurut ulama-ulama sahabat, para tabiin, dan ulama-ulama kemudian, Ismaillah yang menjadi sembelihan Ibrahim. Pendapat yang mengatakan sembelihan itu Ishak sangat salah dipandang dari pelbagai segi. Ibnu Taimiyah, sebagaimana dikutip Ibnu al-Qayyim, berkata, "Pendapat tersebut dilancarkan oleh Ahli Kitab, padahal ia bertentangan dengan isi kitab sendiri."

Dalam kitab Taurat dikatakan bahwasanya Allah memerintahkan Ibrahim menyembelih anaknya yang pertama lahir. Baik orang Islam maupun Ahli Kitab sepakat bahwa putra yang pertama kali lahir adalah Ismail. Akan tetapi kemudian, mereka melakukan pemutarbalikan isi Taurat dengan mencantumkan kata-kata: Sembelihlah anakmu Ishak. Menurut Ibnu Taimiyah, "Itulah tambahan hasil pemutarbalikan orang Yahudi, karena tambahan itu bertentangan dengan kata-kata anak pertama, satu-satunya kedengkian mereka kepada keturunan Ismail yang memperoleh kemuliaan, menyebabkan mereka melakukan pemalsuan isi kitab ini."

Alasan kedua yang dikemukakan Ibnu Taimiyah didasarkan pada keterangan Al-Qur'an:

Maka Kami sampaikan kepadanya kabar gembira tentang (kelahiran) Ishak dan setelah Ishak (akan lahir) Yakub. (Hud/11: 71)

Allah mengabarkan kepada Sarah akan kelahiran Ishak, yang akan menurunkan anak yang bernama Yakub. Maka tidaklah mungkin Allah menyampaikan kelahiran Ishak lalu memerintahkan menyembelihnya padahal telah dinyatakan darinya akan diturunkan Yakub. Bagaimana mungkin Yakub lahir ke dunia kalau bapaknya dijadikan sembelihan, padahal dia dijanjikan akan lahir dari keturunan Ishak? Jadi kalau demikian bukanlah Ishak yang dijadikan sembelihan tetapi Ismail.

Alasan ketiga Ibnu Taimiyah menunjuk berita Ibrahim dan anaknya dalam Surah ash-shaffat ini. Dalam ayat 103-111 diceritakan ketika Ibrahim akan menyembelih anaknya untuk melaksanakan perintah Allah, lalu datang suara menegurnya dari belakang, yang menyeru bahwa Ibrahim dengan tindakannya itu dipandang sudah melaksanakan perintah Allah. Atas ketaatannya yang tulus itu, Ibrahim memperoleh pahala dan pujian dari Allah.

Sesudah peristiwa itu, Allah lalu memberitahu Ibrahim tentang kelahiran Ishak, sebagai ganjaran Allah atas kesabaran dan ketaatannya. Dengan demikian, tentu bukan Ishak yang akan disembelih, karena dia belum lahir.

Alasan keempat: bahwa peristiwa Ibrahim akan menyembelih anaknya itu terjadi di dekat Mekah, tidak ada yang meragukan. Oleh karena itu, ibadah kurban diadakan pada hari raya haji. Juga sa'i antara Safa dan Marwah serta melempar jumrah dalam ibadah haji merupakan kenangan pada peristiwa yang menimpa Ismail dan ibunya. Seperti diketahui, Ismail dan ibunya tinggal di Mekah. Waktu dan tempat ibadah kurban selalu dihubungkan dengan Baitulharam. Jika sekiranya Ishak yang akan dijadikan sembelihan, tentulah upacara ibadah kurban diadakan di tempat dimana Ishak tinggal (Syam), tidak di Mekah.

Demikianlah beberapa alasan yang dikemukakan Ibnu Taimiyah untuk membantah pendapat yang mengatakan bahwa Ishak yang menjadi sembelihan itu. (Lihat juga keterangan yang terdapat dalam kosakata Ibrahim dan Ismail)
112.text_translation: Dan Kami beri dia kabar gembira dengan (kelahiran) Ishak seorang nabi yang termasuk orang-orang yang saleh.
112.text_translation_en: And [in time] We gave him the glad tiding of Isaac, [who, too, would be] a prophet, one of the righteous;

113.text_tafsir_en: This verse explains that the blessedness and prosperity of earthly life and the afterlife are bestowed by God upon Abraham and Isaac. From both were born descendants that were widespread and from their descendants many prophets and apostles appeared. Muslims are asked to pray to God every time that Abraham and his family are blessed and blessed. From their grandsons who spread far and wide on the face of the earth, there are those who do good and some do wrong to themselves. Those who do good are those who believe in God, uphold His commandments, and abstain from His prohibition according to the instructions of His apostles. But those who have wronged themselves are those who disobey the religion of the apostles, and who are corrupt and apostate. This verse reminds people that from their noble and honorable family, the possibility of a good or bad offspring is born. Descendants or races do not guarantee the dignity or contempt of posterity as they are still dependent on education and training for children. Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob were the people whom God declared to have reached the glory level. The Word of God: And remember Our servants: Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, with great powers and (high) knowledge. (shad / 38: 45) However, the descendants of Jacob called the Children of Israel, both in ancient and modern history, suffered greatly and suffered humiliation. The reason is because they have done wrong to themselves, are unfaithful to their ancestors, and have forsaken the guidance of God and the prophets.
113.text_tafsir:
Ayat ini menjelaskan bahwa keberkahan dan kesejahteraan hidup dunia dan akhirat dilimpahkan Allah kepada Ibrahim dan Ishak. Dari keduanya lahir keturunan yang tersebar luas dan dari keturunan mereka banyak muncul para nabi dan rasul. Orang Islam disuruh agar selalu memohon kepada Tuhan setiap kali salat kiranya Ibrahim dan keluarganya diberi berkah dan kebahagiaan.

Dari anak cucu mereka yang menyebar luas di muka bumi, ada yang berbuat kebaikan dan ada pula yang zalim terhadap dirinya sendiri. Mereka yang berbuat baik ialah mereka yang beriman kepada Allah, menjunjung tinggi perintah-Nya, dan menjauhi larangan-Nya sesuai dengan petunjuk rasul-rasul-Nya. Adapun mereka yang berbuat zalim terhadap dirinya ialah mereka yang mengingkari agama yang dibawa para rasul serta berbuat fasik dan kemaksiatan.

Ayat ini mengingatkan manusia bahwa dari keluarganya yang mulia dan terhormat, kemungkinan lahir turunan yang baik atau jelek. Keturunan atau ras tidak memberikan jaminan untuk menjadi mulia atau hina bagi keturunan karena hal itu masih tergantung kepada usaha pendidikan dan pembinaan terhadap anak. Ibrahim, Ishak, dan Yakub adalah orang-orang yang dinyatakan Allah telah mencapai tingkat kemuliaan. Firman Allah:

Dan ingatlah hamba-hamba Kami: Ibrahim, Ishak, dan Yakub yang mempunyai kekuatan-kekuatan yang besar dan ilmu-ilmu (yang tinggi). (shad/38: 45)

Akan tetapi, keturunan Yakub yang disebut Bani Israil, baik dalam sejarah kuno maupun sejarah modern, banyak sekali mengalami penderitaan dan penghinaan. Penyebabnya adalah karena mereka berbuat zalim terhadap diri mereka sendiri, durhaka terhadap leluhur mereka, dan meninggalkan petunjuk Allah dan para nabi.
113.text_translation: Dan Kami limpahkan keberkahan kepadanya dan kepada Ishak. Dan di antara keturunan keduanya ada yang berbuat baik dan ada (pula) yang terang-terangan berbuat zalim terhadap dirinya sendiri.
113.text: وَبٰرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَعَلٰٓى اِسْحٰقَۗ وَمِنْ ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحْسِنٌ وَّظَالِمٌ لِّنَفْسِهٖ مُبِيْنٌ ࣖ
113.text_translation_en: and We blessed him and Isaac: but among the offspring of these two there were [des­tined] to be both doers of good and such as would glaringly sin against themselves.

114.text_tafsir_en: God explained that He had given Moses and Aaron great enjoyment of prophecy and apostasy. They were also entrusted with the duty of leading the Children of Israel and liberating them from Pharaoh's slavery and bringing them back to their homeland. This task is very heavy. If it had not been for God's help, they would have perished. The story of Moses is mentioned most in the Qur'an. As an apostle, he had many similarities with the Prophet Muhammad as described in Surah al-Muzzammil / 73 verse 15.
114.text_tafsir:
Allah menjelaskan bahwa Dia telah menganugerahkan kepada Musa dan Harun kenikmatan yang besar yakni kenabian dan kerasulan. Mereka juga diberi kepercayaan untuk memikul tugas yang mulia yaitu memimpin Bani Israil dan membebaskan mereka dari perbudakan Fir'aun dan membawa kembali ke negeri asal mereka. Tugas ini sangat berat. Jika bukan karena pertolongan Allah, tentu mereka mengalami kebinasaan.

Kisah Musa paling banyak disebutkan dalam Al-Qur'an. Sebagai seorang rasul, dia mempunyai banyak persamaan dengan Nabi Muhammad sebagaimana diterangkan Allah dalam Surah al-Muzzammil/73 ayat 15.
114.text_translation: Dan sungguh, Kami telah melimpahkan nikmat kepada Musa dan Harun.
114.text_translation_en: THUS, INDEED, did We bestow Our favour upon Moses and Aaron;

115.text_tafsir_en: In this verse, God describes the six blessings that were given to Moses and Aaron. The blessings were First, Moses, Aaron, and his people were saved from the great disaster. For a long time, the Israelites lived in Egypt under Pharaoh's control. They were told to do hard work by force and were treated as slaves. Even their sons were killed and the girls were left to live by the orders and prophecies of the shamans surrounding Pharaoh. They would have been devastated if Moses and Aaron had not come to their rescue. Second, besides being rescued by Pharaoh's attacks, even Pharaoh sinking to the bottom of the sea, the Israelites succeeded in defeating the other enemies, and recapturing their lands. They were able to accumulate the wealth they had acquired throughout their lives, to be a strong nation, and to have the strength and power to have great nations like the days of King Talut and David. God's Word: So they defeated him by the will of God, and David killed the people. Then Allah gave him (David) the kingdom, and wisdom, and taught him what He desired. (al-Baqarah / 2: 251)
115.text_tafsir:
Pada ayat ini, Allah menjelaskan enam nikmat yang telah diberikan kepada Musa dan Harun. Nikmat-nikmat itu ialah

Pertama, Musa, Harun, dan kaumnya diselamatkan dari bencana yang besar. Sejak lama, orang Israil hidup di Mesir di bawah kekuasaan Fir'aun. Mereka disuruh melakukan pekerjaan yang berat dengan paksa dan diperlakukan sebagai budak belian. Bahkan anak laki-laki mereka banyak yang dibunuh dan anak-anak perempuan dibiarkan hidup atas perintah dan ramalan dukun-dukun yang mengelilingi Fir'aun. Hampir saja mereka mengalami kemusnahan, jika Musa dan Harun tidak datang menyelamatkan mereka.

Kedua, di samping tertolongnya mereka dari kejaran Fir'aun, bahkan Firaun tenggelam di dasar laut, Bani Israil berhasil pula mengalahkan musuh-musuh lainnya, dan merebut kembali negeri-negeri mereka. Mereka kembali dapat mengumpulkan harta kekayaan yang mereka peroleh sepanjang hidup, menjadi bangsa yang kuat, serta memiliki kekuatan dan kekuasaan hingga memiliki negara yang besar seperti zaman raja Talut dan Daud. Firman Allah:

Maka mereka mengalahkannya dengan izin Allah, dan Daud membunuh Jalut. Kemudian Allah memberinya (Daud) kerajaan, dan hikmah, dan mengajarinya apa yang Dia kehendaki¦. (al-Baqarah/2: 251)
115.text_translation: Dan Kami selamatkan keduanya dan kaumnya dari bencana yang besar,
115.text_translation_en: and We saved them and their people from the awesome calamity [of bondage],

116.text_translation: dan Kami tolong mereka, sehingga jadilah mereka orang-orang yang menang.
116.text_translation_en: and succoured them, so that [in the end] it was they who achieved victory.

117.text_tafsir_en: These two verses describe the blessing God gave to the Children of Israel. The past two favors are outward pleasures and then the following two are inner pleasures, two kinds of divine gifts that save and enhance their souls and morals. Third, God gave Moses and Aaron a very clear Torah and contained the conditions and guidelines for the happiness of life in this world and the Hereafter. Allah said: And verily, We gave to Moses and Aaron, Furqan (the Book of the Torah) and explanations and lessons for the righteous. (al-Anbiya '/ 21: 48) This book was passed on to the Children of Israel as their possession. The Word of God: And verily, We have given Moses guidance; and passed the Book (Torah) to the Children of Israel as a guide and warning to those who were of sound mind. (al-Mu'min / 40: 53-54) Fourth, God shows the way of righteousness to both of them to true happiness. In a sense, they both carry out and follow Divine guidance, both in the field of faith and in religion, and God still grants them his protection and protection.
117.text_tafsir:
Dua ayat ini menjelaskan nikmat yang diberikan Allah kepada Bani Israil. Dua macam nikmat yang lalu merupakan kenikmatan lahiriah maka dua macam berikut ini kenikmatan batiniah, yakni dua macam anugerah Tuhan yang menyelamatkan dan meningkatkan jiwa dan akhlak mereka.

Ketiga, Allah memberikan kepada Musa dan Harun kitab Taurat yang sangat jelas dan memuat ketentuan-ketentuan dan petunjuk baik untuk kebahagiaan hidup di dunia maupun akhirat. Allah berfirman:

Dan sungguh, Kami telah memberikan kepada Musa dan Harun, Furqan (Kitab Taurat) dan penerangan serta pelajaran bagi orang-orang yang bertakwa. (al-Anbiya'/21: 48)

Kitab ini diwariskan kepada Bani Israil untuk dijadikan pegangan hidup mereka. Firman Allah:

Dan sungguh, Kami telah memberikan petunjuk kepada Musa; dan mewariskan Kitab (Taurat) kepada Bani Israil untuk menjadi petunjuk dan peringatan bagi orang-orang yang berpikiran sehat. (al-Mu'min/40: 53-54)

Keempat, Allah menunjukkan jalan kebenaran kepada keduanya untuk menuju kepada kebahagiaan yang hakiki. Dengan akal pikiran, keduanya menjalankan dan mengikuti petunjuk-petunjuk Ilahi, baik dalam bidang akidah maupun muamalah, dan Allah masih menganugerahkan kepada mereka taufik dan perlindungan-Nya.
117.text_translation: Dan Kami berikan kepada keduanya Kitab yang sangat jelas,
117.text_translation_en: And We gave them the divine writ that made [right and wrong] distinct,

118.text_translation: dan Kami tunjukkan keduanya jalan yang lurus.
118.text_translation_en: and guided them the straight way,

119.text_tafsir_en: Then God described the other pleasures that He had given to Moses and Aaron, just as God gave them to Noah and Abraham. The glory is: God makes the name of his second name admirable among the prophets and men of all time. Likewise, praise and prayer continue to be given to him. God spoke of peace to Moses and Aaron so that angels, spirits, and humans would say goodbye to both. By their greetings their names will be preserved forever.
119.text_tafsir:
Kemudian Allah menerangkan kenikmatan lain yang merupakan kemuliaan yang diberikan-Nya kepada Musa dan Harun, sebagaimana yang diberikan Allah kepada Nuh dan Ibrahim. Kemuliaan itu ialah:

Allah mengabadikan sebutan keharuman nama keduanya yang mengharumkan di kalangan para nabi dan umat manusia sepanjang masa. Begitu juga dengan pujian dan doa terus diberikan kepadanya.

Allah menyebutkan salam sejahtera bagi Musa dan Harun agar para malaikat, jin, dan manusia menyebutkan salam juga bagi keduanya. Dengan ucapan salam sejahtera itu maka nama mereka akan tetap harum selama-lamanya.
119.text_translation: Dan Kami abadikan untuk keduanya (pujian) di kalangan orang-orang yang datang kemudian,
119.text_translation_en: and left them thus to be remem­bered among later generations:

120.text_tafsir_en: Then God described the other pleasures that He had given to Moses and Aaron, just as God gave them to Noah and Abraham. The glory is: God makes the name of his second name admirable among the prophets and men of all time. Likewise, praise and prayer continue to be given to him. God spoke of peace to Moses and Aaron so that angels, spirits, and humans would say goodbye to both. By their greetings their names will be preserved forever.
120.text_tafsir:
